text: In metalworking, casting is the act of pouring liquid metal in to a mold. When it hardens it is sometimes called a cast or casting. Casting processes have been used for thousands of years. It is widely used for making sculptures, jewelry, weapons and tools. == Process == To cast iron, which is the most common material for casting, metal is first melted. It is then poured into a mold and let cool. After cooling, it may be grinded to become smooth, or hammered to become stronger. == Other websites == Category:Sculpture Category:Metalworking
title: Casting (metalworking)
